newsitem.title: NORWAY: NORDIC SKIING-PROFILE OF WINNER OF WOMEN'S 30-KM.
newsitem.headline: NORDIC SKIING-PROFILE OF WINNER OF WOMEN'S 30-KM.

text.p: Profile of the winner of Saturday's women's 30-km, classical style cross-country race at the Nordic skiing world championships: Name: Yelena Vialbe Country: Russia Age: 28 Previous world championship titles: 13 Other facts: The most successful woman in cross-country skiing history, Vialbe scored a record 40 World Cup wins and won two Olympic golds and nine world titles before coming to Trondheim. Vialbe took gold in all five cross-country events of the 1997 championships. She won the 15-km, the 10-km pursuit, the relay and the 30-km. She was awarded gold in the 5-km, in which she finished second, after compatriot Lyubov Yegorova was stripped of her world title for testing positive for banned stimulant Bromantan. No woman had won all events in one single world championships since Galina Kulakova of the Soviet Union did it in 1974 in Falun, Sweden.
